title: FARM SCHOOL: How to Do Sucessfully Farming In Africa "Simple Techniques"

tasks.task: Choose appropriate farming based on capability and interest
subtasks: Identify personal interests in farming
Assess own capabilities for specific types of farming

tasks.task: Gaining knowledge about the chosen farming
subtasks: Research farming techniques online (e.g., Google, YouTube)
Understand the growth processes of the chosen crop (e.g., maize)
Hiring knowledgeable experts for farming
Investing in quality equipment and inputs
Adhering to timely farming activities (e.g., planting, fertilizing, cultivating)
Maintaining a clean farm environment to prevent pests and diseases

tasks.task: Planning market strategy for agricultural products
subtasks: Identifying target customers for products
Determining methods for delivering products to market
Anticipating potential product deterioration and planning for storage or sale
Setting business plans for selling products at competitive prices

tasks.task: Choose appropriate farming based on capability and interest**
subtasks: Identify personal interests in specific farming activities (e.g., maize, other crops).
Assess own capabilities for chosen farming methods.

tasks.task: Gaining knowledge about the chosen farming**
subtasks: Research farming techniques through online resources (e.g., Google, YouTube).
Understand the growth processes and management of the chosen crop (e.g., maize).
Hire knowledgeable experts to manage the farm when absent.
Invest in quality equipment and inputs for the farm.
Adhere to timely farming activities (e.g., planting, fertilizing, cultivation).
Maintain a clean farm environment to prevent pests and diseases.

tasks.task: Planning market strategy for agricultural products**
subtasks: Identify target customers for the products.
Determine methods for delivering products to market.
Anticipate and plan for product deterioration (e.g., storage, sale).
Develop business plans for competitive pricing and sales.
